Question: At the initial position, you are asked to navigate to the mangrove tree in front of the door. At the current location, if the mangrove in front of the door is not in your field of view, what is the most relevant object in your field of view, and where is this object?  
choose:  
A. I don't see the mangroves in front of the door, but there is the main entrance of a tall building across the street on the left side of my field of view.  
B. I see the mangroves in front of the door.  
C. I don't see the mangrove in front of the door, but the roof of the high-rise building is in the upper right part of my field of view.  
D. I don't see the mangroves in front of the door, but there is a highway overpass in the lower right corner of my field of view.  
E. I don't see the mangrove in front of the door, but the main entrance of the high-rise building is in the lower left part of my field of view.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: D; Reason: The mangrove in front of the door is not visible in the current field of view. Instead, a highway overpass is prominently seen in the lower right corner of the field of view, making it the most relevant object present.

The most prominent object in the initial field of view is the tall, high-rise building on the left. The lower left portion of the screen shows the base of this building, which would logically contain its main entrance. Therefore, "the main entrance of the high-rise building is in the lower left part of my field of view" is the most accurate description of a relevant object.

The provided answer (Option D) is incorrect because the highway overpass is not visible in the initial field of view (0:00-0:02). The camera pans down and to the right, revealing the highway overpass much later in the video, starting around 0:05 and becoming clearly visible around 0:10. The question specifically asks about the "initial position".
